get.description: The "List campaigns" section allows users to retrieve a list of campaigns associated with their account. Users can view details such as campaign IDs and names, enabling them to manage and track their marketing efforts effectively. Pagination options are available for handling large sets of campaign data.

description.example: This is a description of the campaign.

get.description: The "Get campaign name" section allows users to retrieve the name of a specific campaign by providing the campaign ID. This feature is helpful for accessing campaign details and integrating them into external systems or applications. By utilizing this functionality, users can easily access and display campaign names without the need for manual input.

parameters.name: campaignId
parameters.description: Your campaign's ID - you can get it from the list endpoint or the URL when you have the campaign opened in the app.

get.description: This section allows users to retrieve the status of a specific campaign using its ID. By accessing this information, users can track the progress and performance of their campaigns without the need to navigate through multiple screens or interfaces. This feature streamlines the monitoring process and provides quick access to essential campaign status data.

parameters.name: campaignId

post.description: This section allows users to set a new name for their campaign. By providing the campaign ID and the desired name, users can easily update the name of their campaign. This feature simplifies the process of managing and organizing campaigns within the platform.
This endpoint sets the campaign's sending accounts to emails in the account_list. To add or remove a single sending account, skip to the next section.
This endpoint helps add a single sending account to the specified campaign.
This endpoint helps to remove multiple sending accounts from the specified campaign.

The Launch campaign section allows users to initiate the launch of a campaign within the system. By providing the necessary parameters, such as the API key and campaign ID, users can trigger the campaign launch process seamlessly. The response will indicate the status of the launch operation, ensuring visibility and clarity on the campaign's progress.

campaignId.description: Your campaign's ID - you can get it from the list endpoint or the URL when you have the campaign opened in the app.

post.description: The "Pause campaign" section allows users to temporarily halt a specific campaign within their account. By pausing a campaign, users can prevent it from being actively displayed or executed, providing control and flexibility in managing their marketing efforts. This functionality helps users optimize their campaigns by allowing them to make adjustments or assess performance before resuming activity.

campaignId.description: Your campaign's ID - you can get it from the list endpoint or the URL when you have the campaign opened in the app.

emailReplied.description: Whether the email has been replied to.

post.description: This section allows users to delete specific contacts from a campaign. Users can remove contacts by providing the campaign ID and other optional parameters, such as deleting contacts with matching domains. The action helps users efficiently manage their campaign's contact database by removing unwanted entries.

campaignId.description: The unique identifier of the campaign.

deleteAllFromCampaign.description: Flag indicating whether to delete all contacts from the specified company.

deleteList.description: List of email addresses to be deleted from the campaign.

post.description:
This endpoint allows users to update the status of a specific contact within a campaign. Users can provide the campaign ID and the email address of the contact they want to update, along with the new status.

**Possible values for new_status:**

**Basic types:**
- `Active`
- `Completed`
- `Unsubscribed`

**Additional types:**

> Setting the status to one of these values will also mark the sequence as ‘Completed’ for the contact:
- `Interested`
- `Meeting Booked`
- `Meeting Completed`
- `Closed`
- `Out of Office`
- `Not Interested`
- `Wrong Person`

You can similarly send the label text if you'd like to apply custom labels. For example, if you have a custom label called “My Label,” you can simply set the `new_status` parameter to “My Label”. Please note that this is **case-insensitive** so it will have the same effect if you send “my label” (instead of “My Label”).

campaignId.description: The unique identifier of the campaign.

email.description: The email address of the contact whose status is to be updated.

newStatus.description: The new status to assign to the contact.

post.description: When using this endpoint, all keys appearing in the variables property must already exist in the contact's data. If you'd like to add a new variable, skip to the next section.

campaignId.description: The unique identifier of the campaign.

email.description: The email address of the contact whose variables are to be updated.

variables.description: An object containing key-value pairs of the variables to update.

firstName.description: The first name of the contact.

lastName.description: The last name of the contact.

post.description: The Contact Variable | Set section allows users to update and set custom variables for a contact within a specific campaign. By providing the email address of the contact and the desired variables, users can customize and enhance their contact data for targeted marketing efforts. This functionality enables users to dynamically adjust and personalize contact information to better engage with potential customers.

campaignId.description: The unique identifier of the campaign.

email.description: The email address of the contact whose variables are to be updated.

variables.description: An object containing key-value pairs of the variables to update.

firstName.description: The first name of the contact.

lastName.description: The last name of the contact.

post.description: Use this endpoint to remove attributes (variables) from a contact. Set variables as a list of attributes you want to remove.

campaignId.description: The unique identifier of the campaign.

email.description: The email address of the contact whose variables are to be updated.

variables.description: An array containing the keys of the variables to update.

post.description:
This endpoint searches for People. Newer plans utilizing Export Credits will be deducting 1 export credit when calling this endpoint.

### Search Parameters Table
| Parameter | Description | Example |
|-----------|-------------|----------|
| name (optional) | Full name of the people for exact match or fuzzy search | "John Smith" |
| locations (optional) | List of countries to include (e.g., target audience regions) | ["United States", "Germany", "Australia"] |
| cities (optional) | List of specific cities where the people is located | ["San Francisco", "Berlin", "Sydney"] |
| states (optional) | List of specific states or provinces | ["California", "Bavaria", "New South Wales"] |
| excludeCountries (optional) | Countries to exclude from results | ["China", "Russia"] |
| excludeCity (optional) | Cities to exclude from results | ["Beijing", "Moscow"] |
| excludeStates (optional) | States to exclude from results | ["Sichuan", "Moscow Oblast"] |
| titles (optional) | Job titles to include (matches any of the given titles) | ["Software Engineer", "Product Manager"] |
| excludeTitles (optional) | Job titles to exclude (filters out any matches) | ["Intern", "Contractor"] |
| industries (optional) | Industry categories to include (e.g., sectors like fintech, energy) | ["Fintech", "Renewable Energy"] |
| excludeIndustries (optional) | Industry categories to exclude | ["Fishery", "Tobacco"] |
| technologies (optional) | Technologies/tools the people is associated with | ["TypeScript", "AWS", "React"] |
| companyDomains (optional) | Company domain names to include (newline-separated) | ["google.com\nmicrosoft.com"] |
| excludeCompanyDomains (optional) | Company domains to exclude (newline-separated) | Example: ["facebook.com\ntwitter.com"] |
| employeeCount (optional) | Company size ranges (in employees). Can be single values or ranges like "1,10" | ['1', '10'] or ['1,10', '50,100'] |
| annualRevenue (optional) | Filter by company's estimated annual revenue (in USD) | ['5000000'] |
| totalFunding (optional) | Total company funding received (in USD) | ['10000'] |
| keywords (optional) | Relevant keywords found in job titles, bios, etc | ["blockchain", "AI", "cybersecurity"] |
| excludeKeywords (optional) | Keywords to exclude from matched people | ["retail", "fast food"] |
| intents (optional) | Buyer intent categories such as business interests or niche markets | ["agritech", "airquality"] |
| intentTopics (optional) | Subtopics within an intent category (e.g., areas of focus) | ["botany", "cellular agriculture"] |
| intentScores (optional) | People intent level toward a topic (prioritized as "high", "medium", "low") | ["high", "medium", "low"] |
| page | Page number for paginated results | 1 |
| perPage | An integer to load perPage results on a page. Should be in inclusive range [1, 100] | 25 |

name.description: The full name of the people.

industries.description: Industries the people is involved in.

companyDomains.description: Company domains associated with the people.

id.description: The unique identifier of the people.

firstName.description: The first name of the people.

lastName.description: The last name of the people.

name.description: The full name of the people.

title.description: The job title of the people.

email.description: The email address of the people.

photoUrl.description: The URL to the people profile photo.

twitterUrl.description: The Twitter profile URL of the people.

post.description:
This endpoint searches for organizations. Newer plans utilizing Export Credits will be deducting 1 export credit when calling this endpoint.

### Search Parameters Table
| Parameter        | Description                                                            | Example                  |
|-----------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------|
| locations       | List of countries or regions to find companies located in               | ["United States", "Germany", "Russia"]          |
| companyKeywords| Keywords found in company names, bios, descriptions, or tags            | ["aws", "cloud"]                  |
| domainNames     | Filter companies by domain name(s) (e.g., corporate websites)           | ["amroodlabs.com", "example.com"]       |
| technologies    | Technologies the company uses, such as tools, stacks, or infrastructure | ["JavaScript", "Kubernetes"]           |
| industryNames   | Target industries where companies operate                               | ["Accounting", "Information Technology"]           |
| annualRevenue  | Minimum and maximum company revenue in USD (can be partial range)       | [1000, 1222]            |
| employees       | Employee count range as a string, using comma for bounds                | "1, 10"                  |
| orgName         | Company name for fuzzy or exact search                                  | "amrood labs"            |
| startFrom       | An integer that allows you to paginate through the results              | 1                        |
| perPage        | An integer to load perPage results on a page. Should be in inclusive range [1, 100] | 25     |

get.description:
**Data License Overview**

At **Success.ai**, we provide massive people and company datasets, as well as intent, job postings and IP web traffic de-anonymization data through **various licenses**. Whether you need our entire dataset or a custom subset, we can tailor a solution to meet your specific needs. To learn more, speak with one of our **Data Consultants**.

**The Value of a Success.ai License**

1. **On-Premise Data Access**: During the license period, you have the right to use the data on your premises in any way, as long as it complies with our **Terms and Conditions**.
2. **Fastest Refresh Rate in the Industry**: We refresh our people and company data **continuously**, ensuring you always have the most up-to-date information. Updated files are delivered within a **maximum range of 4 to 8 weeks**, so your data stays current and actionable.
3. **Unmatched Data Coverage**: Our dataset offers the largest **global coverage** with a focus on **accuracy, depth, and relevance**.
4. **Dedicated Customer Success Team**: Our Data-feed and API customers receive dedicated support, including **Email support** on weekdays from **9:00 AM – 5:00 PM Eastern Time**, excluding holidays.
5. **Unlimited Access at Scale**: Unlike search and matching APIs that become costly at scale, **Success.ai** provides **unlimited access** to high-quality data at a fraction of the price, making it ideal for **large-scale projects**.
6. **Flexible Licensing Options**: We allow you to **customize the data** to ensure you only receive—and pay for—the profiles that matter most to your business.

**Tailored Delivery Solutions**

We offer a variety of delivery options to suit your needs, including **Cloud Platforms**: Deliveries via **S3, Snowflake**, flat files and more.

**Why Choose Success.ai?**

* ✅ **Fastest Refresh Rate**: Stay ahead with data updated **continuously**.
* 🌍 **Global Reach**: Access to **millions of verified profiles worldwide**.
* 💰 **Cost-Effective**: Unlimited access at the market's most **competitive price**.
* 🔍 **Tailored Solutions**: Custom datasets to fit your **unique requirements**.
* 💡 **Exceptional Support**: Dedicated **customer success team** to ensure your success.

**Overview**

This documentation provides comprehensive information about Success.ai's B2B contact and company datasets available on data.success.ai as well as Snowflake Marketplace. It outlines our data sources, collection methodology, data processing techniques, quality assurance procedures, update frequency, and technical specifications to help users understand, evaluate, and effectively utilize our datasets.

**Data Sources**

**Primary Sources**
- Publicly Available Business Information
- Professional networking platforms (e.g., LinkedIn)
- Company websites and directories
- Business social media profiles
- Public business registries and databases

**Web Data Collection**
- Structured data from public web sources
- Manifestly public data under GDPR Article 9.2(e)

**Third-Party Data Providers**
- Partnerships with reputable data aggregators
- Business information services

**User-Contributed Data**
- Opt-in business contact information
- Professional information shared within our platform

**Data Processing Methodology**

**Data Extraction and Standardization**
- Automated tools for public web data collection
- API-based extraction from partner platforms
- Bulk imports from data partnerships

**Standardization Procedures**
- Field normalization across sources
- Country-specific formatting standardization
- Company and industry classification mapping
- Job title normalization and hierarchy classification

**Data Enrichment**
- Entity Resolution and Matching
  - Identify and merge duplicate records
  - Cross-validation across sources
  - Probabilistic and deterministic matching
- Data Augmentation
  - Bespoke algorithms for enrichment
  - Company hierarchy mapping
  - Contact role and seniority classification
  - Technology stack enrichment

message.example: Data processing methodology information retrieved successfully

get.description:

**Refresh Frequency**
- Continuous, Daily refresh
- Updates every 4-8 weeks

**Update Methodology**
- Continuous monitoring
- Delta detection
- Event-triggered updates

**Historical Versioning**
- Point-in-time recovery
- Change history tracking
- Audit trails

get.description:
**Data Security and Compliance**

**Privacy Compliance**
* **GDPR Compliance**
  * Processing based on legitimate interests (GDPR Article 6.1(f))
  * Processing of manifestly public data (GDPR Article 9.2(e))
  * Data subject rights honored (access, erasure, rectification, portability)
* **CCPA Compliance**
  * Consumer rights honored
  * Disclosure of collection practices
  * Opt-out mechanisms

**Data Security Measures**
* **Storage Security**
  * Data encryption at rest and in transit
  * Secure cloud platforms (Azure)
  * Compliance with industry-leading security standards
* **Access Controls**
  * IP restriction for server access
  * Web application firewalls
  * Secure authentication practices

**Technical Specifications**

**Data Schema**
| **Field Category** | **Example Fields** | **Description** |
|-------------------|-------------------|-----------------|
| Identity | Full Name, Email, Phone | Contact identification information |
| Professional | Job Title, Department, Seniority | Professional role information |
| Company | Company Name, Industry, Size | Organizational details |
| Location | Country, City, Region | Geographic information |
| Social | LinkedIn URL, Twitter Handle | Professional social profiles |
| Technology | Tech Stack, Tools Used | Technology usage information |
| Custom | Custom Fields as Required | Customer-specific data points |

**File Formats**
* CSV
* JSON
* Parquet
* Other formats available upon request

**Delivery Methods**
* Snowflake
* Amazon S3
* API Access
* Other cloud platforms as needed

**Data License Information**

**License Terms**
* **License Type**: Custom licenses; one-time purchase, monthly/quarterly/yearly subscription
* **Usage Rights**: On-premise data usage subject to Terms and Conditions
* **Customization**: Tailored subsets available based on customer requirements

**Support and Services**
* **Customer Support**: Email support available weekdays (9:00 AM – 5:00 PM Eastern Time)
* **Dedicated Success Team**: For Data-feed and API customers
* **Custom Delivery Options**: Available upon request

**Contact Information**

For questions about our dataset, methodology, or licensing:
* **General Support**: support@success.ai
* **General product demo**: [Book A Demo](https://calendly.com/viktor-success/dataset-data-needs-discussion-success-ai?month=2025-04)
* **Enterprise datasets or high-limit API access**: [Schedule a free consultation](https://calendly.com/viktor-success/dataset-data-needs-discussion-success-ai?month=2025-04)
* **Website**: www.success.ai

**Additional Resources**
* Success.ai [Privacy Policy](https://www.success.ai/privacy-policy)
* Success.ai [Terms & Conditions](https://www.success.ai/terms-and-condition)

200.description: Success - Data security and compliance information

tags.name: Introduction
tags.description:
**Welcome to the Success.ai API Documentation!**

Use the side panel on the left to navigate through different sections, or utilize the search bar in
the top left corner to quickly find specific information.

### Get Started

🚀 **Find Your API Key:** The first step to using the Success.ai API is to locate your unique API key for
authenticating your requests. This key is specific to your Success.ai workspace.
To find your API key, navigate to your: Success.ai Dashboard → Settings → Integrations → API

**Note:** Access to the API key requires a Growth plan or above.

**Enterprise** — Need higher API limits or large datasets? [Book a free consultation](https://calendly.com/viktor-success/dataset-data-needs-discussion-success-ai?month=2025-04) to unlock
unlimited, enterprise-level access.

🔑 **Test Your API Key:** Once you have your API key, you can verify its validity by sending a GET
request to the `/v1/authenticate` endpoint with your `api_key` as a query parameter. See the "Test your API key"
section for detailed instructions and examples.

### Explore Our Capabilities

⚙️ **Explore Endpoints:** Use the navigation panel to the left to discover the various API endpoints
available, including those for managing campaigns, accounts, analytics, and leads. Each section
provides details on the available operations, parameters, request examples, and responses.

💡 **Understand Rate Limits:** Our platform enforces a rate limit of 10 requests per second to
ensure fair usage and prevent abuse. Refer to the "Rate limits" section for more details.

### Contact Exports (Leads) API Rate Limits

| . | Free/Trial | Starter | Growth | Infinity | Enterprise/Custom |
|-------------|----------|---------|---------|----------|-------------------|
| **Minute** | 50 | 50 | 50 | 100 | 1,000 |
| **Hour** | 50 | 200 | 1,000 | 2,000 | Unlimited |
| **Day** | 50 | 1,200 | 5,000 | 10,000 | Unlimited |
| **Month** | 50 | 1,200 | 5,000 | 100,000 | Unlimited |
| **Year** | 600 | 14,400 | 60,000 | 1,200,000| Unlimited |
